alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:30PM CDT until May 20 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. .Accumulating rainfall has occurred across southern Minnesota Friday night into this evening. Totals so far have reached 2 to even 4 plus inches in some localized areas with additional rainfall expected tonight. This has caused river levels in this region to either rapidly rise or delay falling. Crests should occur within the next few days before a dry pattern this coming week allows for rivers to decrease again. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.1 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Cottonwood Street west of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Saturday, the stage was 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Saturday was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 05/01/1986. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
